thread.title: Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson travels with youthful Reds squad to Tenerife in bid to be fit for Merseyside derby
thread.title_full: Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson travels with youthful Reds squad to Tenerife in bid to be fit for Merseyside derby

author: James Pearce
title: Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson travels with youthful Reds squad to Tenerife in bid to be fit for Merseyside derby
text:
Sport Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson travels with youthful Reds squad to Tenerife in bid to be fit for Merseyside derby The Liverpool skipper is desperately trying to recover from a foot injury in time to play in the derby clash with Everton at Anfield Share Liverpool will be keen to get Henderson back to full fitness (Photo: Liverpool FC) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson has joined his teammates on a week-long trip to Tenerife as they begin preparations for the Merseyside derby with Everton on April 1st. 
The Reds boss Jurgen Klopp is making the most of the international break by taking those players not involved with their countries to the Spanish island for a mid-season training camp, reports the Liverpool Echo. 
Henderson has been ruled out of the last four matches with a foot injury he suffered in training prior to the loss against Leicester, but is expected to continue having treatment in a race to be fit for the derby clash. 
Klopp remains hopeful that the Reds midfielder will prove his fitness in time for the Merseyside derby at Anfield a week on Saturday. Jordan Henderson during Liverpool's last training camp in La Manga (Photo: Liverpool FC) Henderson on the ball during a training session at La Manga in February (Photo: Liverpool via Getty) 
However, Daniel Sturridge hasn’t travelled with the Reds striker staying home to continue his rehabilitation programme on a hip problem. Sturridge hasn’t played since last month’s defeat at Hull having suffered from a virus prior to picking up another knock in training. 
With a dozen members of the first-team squad currently away with their countries, Klopp has bolstered his ranks with a number of Academy youngsters. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
